quotes.quote: Cleaning up with children around is like shoveling during a blizzard.
We are used to cleaning the outside house, but the most important house to clean is yourself - your own house - which we never do.
The objective of cleaning is not just to clean, but to feel happiness living within that environment.
Cleaning anything involves making something else dirty, but anything can get dirty without something else getting clean.
Cleaning your house while your kids are still growing up is like shoveling the walk before it stops snowing.
Cleaning with children in the house really is like brushing your teeth while eating Oreos.
Housework is like cleaning fish. No matter how often you do it, it still stinks.
At worst, a house unkept cannot be so distressing as a life unlived.
You don't get anything clean without getting something else dirty.
If you can't clean up after yourself.. There's no need for you to mess things up.. And expect another person to clean up behind you.
Our house is clean enough to be healthy, and dirty enough to be happy.
A man thinks all dust stays outdoors.
Sweeping only moves the dust somewhere else.
A spotless house is a sign of a misspent life.
A new broom sweeps clean, but the old broom knows the corners.
Cleanliness is next to impossible.
Cleaning and organizing is a practice not a project.
Excuse the mess, but we live here.
Dogs do not grasp the concept of house cleaning.
A clean house is the sign of a boring person.
Sometimes clean feels empty. A bit of clutter and dirt gladdens the heart and affirms a life in progress.
Nothing inspires cleanliness more than an unexpected guest.
We dream of having a clean house — but who dreams of actually doing the cleaning?
Cleaning your house while your kids are still growing is like shoveling the walk before it stops snowing.
A recurring cleaning will make you a happy person.
Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning up to do afterward.
One shouldn't clean more than necessary; as unsurpassable amount of cleaning; leads to scraping away the oils of nature; the rudiments of color which add loads of vibrancy to life.
In the daytime when sweeping and dusting and cleaning were quite at an end, he would sit very still on the doorstep.
In the same manner, with all their washing and cleaning they've dirtied. All the troughs of the village, and all the fountains have sullied.
She prides herself on her cleaning habits.
Cleaning my soul. Flame on burn desire.
Please, I'd rather not see us both get caught with cleaning up that could take years.
Cleaning up the world for you and me.
Cleaning up the mess you left behind.
Cleaning sweat and tears from your face . Living down on your knees.
